greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider trajectory of n under the "x->2x+1" map; sequence gives number of steps until a nonsquarefree number is reached.
comment: For n up to 2000, the maximal length is 95, for n=1574.
For n up to 10000, the maximal length is 120, for n=9074. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 18 2012
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
example: If initial x is not squarefree, sequence has zero length (this is denoted by "-"):
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, Aug 13 2006
